thread_structure: "It just stopped working" is what they said. Here's my actual diagnostic process for a commercial dishwasher (techs, tell me what I missed):
Step 1: Check power. Sounds obvious but 30% of "broken" equipment is just a tripped breaker or unplugged cord.
Step 2: Error codes. Modern equipment tells you exactly what's wrong IF you know how to read it. This one: E4 = heating element failure.
Step 3: Verify the code. Error codes lie sometimes. Tested element with multimeter. Reading: OL (open line). Code was right.
Step 4: Find WHY it failed. Element doesn't just die. Found heavy limescale buildup. Water hardness issue nobody addressed.
Step 5: Fix root cause + symptom. New element ($180) + water softener recommendation. Otherwise it fails again in 6 months.
Total time: 35 minutes. But this process comes from 1,000+ repairs. Pattern recognition is everything.
